articles.title: Missiles hit fuel storage facilities near Odesa as Russia continues to blockade the Black Sea - ABC News
articles.description: Russian missile strikes hit an oil refinery and three fuel storage facilities that were used by Ukraine to supply its troops, as the European Union vows to document Russian "atrocities" in the International Court of Justice.
articles.content:
Russian attacks have destroyed an oil refinery in Ukraine's central Poltava region and struck "critical infrastructure", most likely a fuel depot, near the port city of Odesa, local officials said.
